bug.short_desc: Irish hunspell dictionary seems broken (almost empty)
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
The problem exists both on Fedora 24 and Fedora 25:
[mfabian@Fedora-Workstation-netinst-x86_6 ~]$ cat /etc/fedora-release Fedora release 25 (Twenty Five) [mfabian@Fedora-Workstation-netinst-x86_6 ~]$ rpm -qf /usr/share/myspell/ga_IE.dic
hunspell-ga-4.6-11.fc24.noarch [mfabian@Fedora-Workstation-netinst-x86_6 ~]$ [mfabian@Fedora-Workstation-netinst-x86_6 ~]$ cat /usr/share/myspell/ga_IE.dic 5 AAI ABC ACLU ACS Binary file (standard input) matches [mfabian@Fedora-Workstation-netinst-x86_6 ~]$
The last line makes me think that something went wrong generating that file.

Same problem for wa_BE:
[mfabian@Fedora-Workstation-netinst-x86_6 ~]$ tail /usr/share/myspell/wa_BE.dic mete/s mg miligrame/s milimete/s mm mots/disriles_viebes mots/mots mots/nos_d_djin mots/nos_d_plaece Binary file (standard input) matches [mfabian@Fedora-Workstation-netinst-x86_6 ~]$ cat /usr/share/myspell/wa_BE.aff
SET CP1252 Binary file wa_affix.dat matches [mfabian@Fedora-Workstation-netinst-x86_6 ~]$

this is basically the same as bug 1316359
caused by regression in GNU grep 2.23, need to just rebuild the package with fixed grep to fix it
hunspell-ga-4.6-12.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-6a4f73e998
hunspell-wa-0.4.17-6.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-9338f80e93
